qas.question: How many full time jobs were there in 2008?
How many jobs in the primary sector were agrictulture?
How many jobs in the primary sector were in forestry or lumber production?
How many jobs are in the secondary sector?
How many jobs are in the tertiary secotr?

context: In 2008[update] the total number of full-time equivalent jobs was <a0_0>125,037.<a0_0/> The number of jobs in the primary sector was 203, of which <a1_0>184<a1_0/> were in agriculture and <a2_0>19<a2_0/> were in forestry or lumber production. The number of jobs in the secondary sector was <a3_0>15,476<a3_0/> of which 7,650 or (49.4%) were in manufacturing, 51 or (0.3%) were in mining and 6,389 (41.3%) were in construction. The number of jobs in the tertiary sector was <a4_0>109,358<a4_0/>. In the tertiary sector; 11,396 or 10.4% were in wholesale or retail sales or the repair of motor vehicles, 10,293 or 9.4% were in the movement and storage of goods, 5,090 or 4.7% were in a hotel or restaurant, 7,302 or 6.7% were in the information industry, 8,437 or 7.7% were the insurance or financial industry, 10,660 or 9.7% were technical professionals or scientists, 5,338 or 4.9% were in education and 17,903 or 16.4% were in health care.
